attribution: The centre of mass of a triangle lies at a point  of the perpendicular distance from the base to the tip.
title: Shelf and brackets

children.value:
A shelf of uniform density is supported by two brackets 
$\frac{1}{8}$
 and 
$\frac{1}{4}$
 of the total length, 
$\vari{L}$
, from each end respectively.
Find the ratio of the forces from the brackets.
The rectangular shelf is now replaced with a triangular shelf, as shown in Figure 1 .
Find the new ratio of the forces on the two brackets.
